forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. East northeast wind around 7 mph. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.shortForecast: Rain then Showers And Thunderstorms Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 10am, then rain showers between 10am and 4pm, then showers and thunderstorms likely. Cloudy, with a high near 58. Southeast wind 6 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Downtown San Francisco wakes under a veil of clouds, the cool embrace of the night lingering as temperatures rise gently. The air is crisp, with hints of moisture promising rain soon, heralded by a soft east northeast breeze whispering through the empty streets. As dawn breaks, expect rain to mingle with the morning fog, transforming the cityscape into a soft watercolor of grays and blues. The persistent chance of showers throughout the day lingers in the air, sprinkled with the thrilling potential of thunderstorms, while the surrounding hills hide in mist, blurring the line between earth and sky.

As the hours pass and the high reaches near 58, a well-timed jaunt through the rain-drenched streets might be invigorating; perhaps a stroll across the Golden Gate Park’s damp trails. Dress in layers—comfortable footwear and a waterproof jacket will serve you well, allowing you to venture outdoors while embracing the brisk elements toeing the line of the early winter chill. And if the heart seeks solace from the rain, a warm café corner beckons, offering steaming beverages that inspire quiet conversations or delightful daydreams, as the city pulsates faintly outside—beautiful, haunting, and ever-so real amid the fog and rain.
